pullRequest.title: Settles a service bus message. Allows receiving in both PEEK_LOCK and RECEIVE_AND_DELETE.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Adds support for Receive and delete mode.
Cleans up deserialization code by adding an additional method to deserialize lists.
Removes creation of cbs node in management channel.
Deserializes lock token from message.
Cleans up loose management constants.
Consolidates message creation in management channel.
Fixes tests.

Fixes #8743
Fixes #8745
Fixes #8744
Fixes #8742

nodes.bodyText:
Any reason why bring back hardcoded value and not using variable senderSettleMode  and receiverSettleMode ?
Later in configureSender() and configureReceiver() these values are hardcoded.
Shouldn't this use provided values ?
MessagingEntityType.QUEUE  Is there a need to know the type ? We will not always know for example if user uses connectionString(String connectionStringWithResourceName) in Builder.
We do not know always what is the entity type.
Do you have test when user do not want autoComplete and  want to call him self ?
Would we expect anyone to modify the return list? I believe Collections.singletonList returns an immutable list.
Does this need to return a Boolean? It doesn't appear to be used by the caller, we just default into a then.
Interesting that this returns false instead of throwing an exception and that the lock token being invalid throws an exception.
Any reason this is called Mono when it is a Flux?

commit.message:
Not tying a connection to a single entityPath. (This is specific to Event Hubs.)Not tying a connection to a single entitytPath. (This is specific to Event Hubs.)

Update Interface to accept multiple messaging entities.

Add reactor receiver for service bus.

Add serialization for list.

Adding MessageWithLockToken

Move deserialization and publish logic to elastic.

Add implementation for other settlement statuses.
